channel.title: Daily News Feed Update #1
channel.description: Daily collected titles from multiple sources

item.title: Bangla Editorials (Update #1) • আজ স্ত্রীর প্রশংসা করার দিন
English Editorials (Update #1) • The Rohingya are being forgotten at the UN • Fisheries policy revamp indispensable

Magazines (Update #1) • Ocean Acidification Threshold Pushes Earth Past Another Planetary Boundary • What is Knot Theory? Solve These Puzzles to Find Out • How Can Galaxies Recede from Us Faster Than the Speed of Light? • An Anechoic Chamber at Nokia Bell Labs Reveals the Hidden Sounds of Your Body • Your happiness in life may not be U-shaped - here's how it could vary • There is an odd streak in the universe – and we still don’t know why • Exceptional star is the most pristine object known in the universe • 20 bird species can understand each other’s anti-cuckoo call • Kids as young as 4 innately use sorting algorithms to solve problems • Why Our Brains, Our Selves won the Royal Society science book prize • Read an extract from Our Brains, Our Selves by Masud Husain • Our verdict on ‘The Dispossessed’: A tricky but rewarding novel

International (Update #1) • Hegseth says four killed in US strike on alleged drug boat off Venezuelan coast • Journalist Mario Guevara deported to El Salvador after 100 days in Ice custody • Fears Quebec Starbucks gang shooting could signal shift to brazen tactics • ‘I use cannabis as medicine’: the US basketball player facing execution in Indonesia over $400 of gummies • China remembers ‘guiding light’ Jane Goodall’s wildlife conservation work • Japan days away from running out of Asahi Super Dry due to cyber attack – reports • Papua New Guinea considers age restrictions on social media amid fears voices will be ‘silenced’ • Two bodies found in Victorian high country by hikers • Dfat officials supporting five Australians in Israeli prison after they were detained on pro-Palestinian flotilla • ‘Yeah, nah’: why the Victorian Liberal party has taken an unusual step in the search for future MPs • Australia’s magpie swooping season returns with a vengeance – and cyclists are their main targets • Andrew Hastie quits Coalition frontbench over immigration policy dispute • Sarah Burton turns up the glamour volume at Givenchy in Paris • Calls for police to shoot down drones after Munich airport disruption – as it happened • Czechs begin voting in election that could return populist to power • Final boat of 42-strong pro-Palestinian flotilla intercepted by Israel • Weather tracker: wet conditions raise risk of flooding in south-eastern Europe • Donald Trump orders Israel to ‘immediately’ stop bombing Gaza as Hamas agrees to free hostages • Egypt foreign minister urges Hamas to accept Trump Gaza plan and disarm • One person dead and thousands of homes without power as Storm Amy arrives • Metropolitan police officer arrested after undercover BBC investigation • Three more arrests in synagogue attack investigation; Lammy heckled at vigil for Manchester synagogue attack – as it happened • Conservatives would take UK out of ECHR, Badenoch confirms • Rabbi who confronted Manchester synagogue attacker vows community will not be defeated • Trump says Hamas response to peace plan means ‘peace in the Middle East’ is ‘very close’ – as it happened • Kansas deputy pressed knee into cuffed Black man for 86 seconds, records show • Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced to more than four years in prison and given $500,000 fine – as it happened • Trump administration to offer unaccompanied minors $2,500 to self-deport, memo reveals • Stunned Combs holds head in hands as judge unmoved by pleas for mercy
